Constructor Detail

Server

public Server(Receivable receivable,
              java.lang.String passPhrase)
       throws java.io.IOException,
              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new ghost server on the default port of 43596

The server initializes its own self-contained thread that will not tie up outside code. Any action initiated by the server is asynchronous. The recommended method of initializing a server is as follows: 


 org.whired.ghostserver.Server ghostServer = new org.whired.ghostserver.Server(new org.whired.ghost.net.Receivable()
 {
        public boolean handlePacket(int id, int length, org.whired.ghost.net.Connection connection)
        {
                // Packet handling logic
        }
 }, "mylongpassphrase");
The above code would be close to the entry point of a server application, where the RSPS server is initialized. For information on how to send a packet using getConnection(), see Connection.sendPacket(int, java.lang.Object[])

Parameters:
receivable - the receivable that will handle incoming packets
passPhrase - required by any connecting ghost clients. Must be at least 6 characters with symbols/numerals or 12 characters without
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the server cannot be initialized
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if passPhrase does not meet the specified criteria

Server

public Server(int port,
              Receivable receivable,
              java.lang.String passPhrase)
       throws java.io.IOException,
              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new ghost server on the port specified

The server initializes its own self-contained thread that will not tie up outside code. Any action initiated by the server is asynchronous. The recommended method of initializing a server is as follows: 


 org.whired.ghostserver.Server ghostServer = new org.whired.ghostserver.Server(new org.whired.ghost.net.Receivable()
 {
        public boolean handlePacket(int id, int length, org.whired.ghost.net.Connection connection)
        {
                // Packet handling logic
        }
 }, "mylongpassphrase");
The above code would be close to the entry point of a server application, where the RSPS server is initialized. For information on how to send a packet using getConnection(), see Connection.sendPacket(int, java.lang.Object[])

Parameters:
port - the port the server will listen on
receivable - the receivable that will handle incoming packets
passPhrase - required by any connecting ghost clients. Must be at least 6 characters with symbols/numerals or 12 characters without
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the server cannot be initialized
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if passPhrase does not meet the specified criteria
